conbody.p: The simplest way to make a request in http-conduit is with the simpleHttp function. This function takes a String giving a URL and returns a ByteString with the contents of that URL. But under the surface, there are a few more steps:

ul.li: A new connection Manager is allocated.
The URL is parsed to a Request. If the URL is invalid, then an exception is thrown.
The HTTP request is made, following any redirects from the server.
If the response has a status code outside the 200-range, an exception is thrown.
The response body is read into memory and returned.
runResourceT is called, which will free up any resources (e.g., the open socket to the server).

conbody.p: If you want more control of what's going on, then you can configure any of the steps above (plus a few more) by explicitly creating a Request value, allocating your Manager manually, and using the http and httpLbs functions.
